definitions.definition: ( countable ) A long, thin piece of land ; any long, thin area.
examples: The countries were in dispute over the ownership of a strip of desert about 100 metres wide.

definitions.definition: ( usually countable , sometimes uncountable ) A long, thin piece of any material; any such material collectively.
examples: Papier mache is made from strips of paper.
Squeeze a strip of glue along the edge and then press down firmly.
I have some strip left over after fitting out the kitchen.

definitions.definition: ( US ) A street with multiple shopping or entertainment possibilities.
( fencing ) The playing area, roughly 14 meters by 2 meters.
( UK , soccer ) The uniform of a football team, or the same worn by supporters .
( mining ) A trough for washing ore .
The issuing of a projectile from a rifled gun without acquiring the spiral motion.
( television ) A television series aired at the same time daily (or at least on Mondays to Fridays), so that it appears as a strip straight across the weekly schedule.
( finance ) An investment strategy involving simultaneous trade with one call and two put options on the same security at the same strike price , similar to but more bearish than a straddle .

main_definition: ( countable ) A long, thin piece of land ; any long, thin area.
secondary_definitions: ( usually countable , sometimes uncountable ) A long, thin piece of any material; any such material collectively.
( US ) A street with multiple shopping or entertainment possibilities.
( fencing ) The playing area, roughly 14 meters by 2 meters.
( UK , soccer ) The uniform of a football team, or the same worn by supporters .
( mining ) A trough for washing ore .
The issuing of a projectile from a rifled gun without acquiring the spiral motion.
( television ) A television series aired at the same time daily (or at least on Mondays to Fridays), so that it appears as a strip straight across the weekly schedule.
( finance ) An investment strategy involving simultaneous trade with one call and two put options on the same security at the same strike price , similar to but more bearish than a straddle .

definitions.definition: The act of removing one's clothes; a striptease .
examples: She stood up on the table and did a strip .

definitions.definition: Denotes a version of a game in which losing players must progressively remove their clothes.

main_definition: The act of removing one's clothes; a striptease .
secondary_definitions: ( attributively , of games ) Denotes a version of a game in which losing players must progressively remove their clothes.
